content.description: The following question is based on the following incomplete declaration of the class BoundedIntArray and its constructor definitions.
content.question: A BoundedintArray represents an indexed list of integers. In a BoundedIntArray the user can specify a size, in which case the indices range from 0 to size - 1. The user can also specify the lowest index, low, in which case the indices can range from low to low + size - 1. public class BoundedIntArray { private int[] myItems; // storage for the list private int myLowIndex; // lowest index public BoundedIntArray(int size) { myItems = new int[size]; myLowIndex = 0; } public BoundedIntArray(int size, int low) { myItems = new int[size]; myLowIndex = low; } // other methods not shown } Consider the following statements. BoundedIntArray arrl = new BoundedIntArray(100, 5); BoundedIntArray arr2 = new BoundedIntArray(100); Which of the following best describes arrl and arr2 after these statements?

choices.label: arrl and arr2 both represent lists of integers indexed from 0 to 99.
arrl represents a list of integers indexed from 0 to 104, and arr2 represents a list of integers indexed from 0 to 99.
arrl represents a list of integers indexed from 5 to 99, and arr2 represents a list of integers indexed from 0 to 99.
arrl represents a list of integers indexed from 5 to 104, and arr2 represents a list of integers indexed from 0 to 99.

content.answer: arrl represents a list of integers indexed from 5 to 104, and arr2 represents a list of integers indexed from 0 to 99.

skill.text: 4.A: Describe the behavior of a code segment or program.
